'speaker_3': 'Communication from Council Member Ranga Council Member Pearce Vice Miriam Richardson. Recommendation to request that the City Council commemorate human rights advocate, farmworker and labor organizer Larry Itliong by declaring October 25th as Larry Itliong Day in the city of Long Beach.'
'speaker_2': 'Councilor Marie Income.'

'speaker_7': 'Thank you, Mayor. I want to start by thanking the members of the Human Relations Commission Civil War here today for bringing this forward. I want to also thank the contributions of Larry Itliong and coming and recommending that the city council recognize his efforts by declaring Larry Itliong day in Long Beach.'

'speaker_7': 'Very really on with. Worker movement. Back in the 1940s and fifties, he worked long say to that Chavez during a time when Filipinos and other immigrant immigrant farmworkers were working to fight discrimination and low wages. He was a prominent leader and one of the greatest social justice movements in the United States of America.'

'speaker_7': 'He organized a group of 1500 Filipinos to strike against grape growers of Delano, California and continued on that strike for eight days. He unified farm workers to combine forces and establish the United Farm Workers of America Organizing Committee of the AFL-CIO, which led to the United Farm Workers of America, one of the greatest unions in the history'

'speaker_7': 'of the nation. The unification of worker, farm, labor workers, of different ethnicities was unprecedented at that time. Setting an example for future generations of working workers and organizers and proving to be one of the reasons for the success of the American Farm Worker Farm Labor Movement.'

'speaker_7': 'The month of October is designated as Filipino American History Month, and with a population of over 30,000 people of Filipino desert Long Beach, it is fitting to recognize Larry Itliong for his role in California and United States history.'
'speaker_7': 'And I would like to recognize his contributions by proclaiming October 25 as Larry Itliong Day in the city of Long Beach. Thank you.'
'speaker_2': 'Vice Mayor Richardson.'

'speaker_8': 'Just want to thank Councilmember U. Ranga for for this gesture. I'm glad I'm happy to support it. And I know that the the Filipino migrant community played a large role in the farmworker movement. And I think it's fitting that that we go ahead and dedicate this day, October 25th, to Mr. Itliong.'
'speaker_8': 'Thanks.'

'speaker_2': 'Thank you. Any public comment on this item? It's going on, everybody. So I'm trying to catch my breath. I just came from the library. So my name is Jerry. Good evening. City Council and Mayor Robert Garcia.'
'speaker_6': 'Oh, okay.'
'speaker_4': 'Okay.'

'speaker_2': 'So my name is Jerry Jimenez. 'speaker_2': 'Filipinos have always been a part of this country's history ever since. 'speaker_2': 'Being born and raised here in Long Beach as a Filipino American, I never learned anything about my culture, my people and the contributions of Filipinos in the U.S.. 'speaker_2': 'And I never really knew that Filipinos had an important role in the grape strike. So it wasn't until 2012 I met the son of Larry Itliong, Johnny Itliong, and learn about how it was the, you know, the Filipino farm workers that went on strike first.'

'speaker_2': 'So I felt empowered, you know, like like Larry Itliong. I needed to do something about, you know, the injustices and social issues that people face in the community. So since I help, you know, high school youth organize, you know, themselves at Cabrillo High, you know, we would teach them like their history and their culture and, you know'

'speaker_2': ', they're blown away, you know, since they haven't really learned about it in the past. So they never really you know, if Larry Itliong and the contributions of the Filipino farmworkers were recognized, all youth would get to know about the history of Filipinos here in the U.S..'

'speaker_2': 'So, you know, the reason why it's important for you to know, you know, this history is because youth can take action on the issues that affect them today. 'speaker_2': 'So, yeah, we hope to we can continue to work together to honor Filipino American History Month and the contributions of Filipinos in the city. Thank you. Thank you. Next speaker, please.'

'speaker_4': 'And I also want to thank other members of council for their support to support this evening. One of the functions of the Human Relations Commission is to help foster attitudes among various groups which lead to civil peace and intergroup understanding, as well as the promotion of full acceptance of all citizens in the community in all aspects of'

'speaker_4': 'community life. And the Human Relations Commission believes that Larry Itliong labor and human rights work has had a lasting, positive impact throughout the state, the country and within our city. 'speaker_4': 'recognizing their young for his human rights contributions. In 2013, Governor Brown signed Assembly Bill 123, requiring California public schools to include the contribution of Filipino Americans to the farm labor movement. 'speaker_4': 'October is Filipino American History Month, and with a population of approximately 30,000 people of Filipino descent, it is evident that the City of Long Beach is an appropriate city to follow the footsteps of other municipalities that have recognized Itliong for his contributions to California and U.S. history as a city, as the as the Long Beach City Council's'

'speaker_4': 'Principal Advisory Commission promoting better understanding among the diverse ethnic cultural groups in Long Beach.
